lines.text: What kind of man gives cigarettes to trees?
[Confessing to his wife that he's a hitman]
So you see, I'm not out there committing adultery. I'm out there committing murder.
Oh, thank God!
[Donald and Jack in a shoot-out to the death]
Jaaaack?
Yeah?
Time out, OK?
Time out?
Time out.
What do you mean, 'time out?'
You're not gonna believe this. I was in a hurry when I left the cabin this morning, and, well, silly me, I got the wrong bullets.
You think Wes is God, don't you.
No, not God, Just an ordinary man. Maybe a little ahead of his time, but just an ordinary man.
Wes is an asshole.
Blasphemy! Oh, you'll smoke a turd in hell for that!
You shot my gun god damn it! You're not supposed to shoot a person's gun! Oh, now that pisses me off! You know how much one of these cost?

[dressed in a face-obscuring, hooded, fur-lined parka]
I feel like a gynecologist for a grizzly bear.
Well, I was nervous.
What about me?
Oh, come off it, man. You're so cool, you piss ice cubes.
It's a hereditary thing in my family, y'know. Uhh, nerves, colitis, y'know.
Colitis? Y'know, that must be horrible being a professional killer with colitis.
Yeah, that's what...
They hear you coming, don't they?
Listen, this is gonna sound like a really stupid question, but, uh, aren't you guys gonna get really bored out here if society doesn't collapse?
I wouldn't worry about that. Wes says society is heading for the big "flush". And we're going to be the ones who are clinging to the rim while everything else goes down.
Eeew!
What're you going to do if things get better?
Is the air getting better?
That's true.
The economy? The Middle East? Arts, literature, television, US Presidents improving?
Anyone can nitpick.
Sonny, name one thing that's gotten better in the last ten years.
[Sonny is stumped]
See?
Video games.
Video games! There you are.
Alright, I acknowledge that.
OK, Mr. Honky Mo-Fo... take your best shot!
I was raised a strict Southern Baptist. I place a high value on human life... $20,000 minimum.
I'm sorry I'm gonna have to blow a large hole in your skivvy heart.
[first lines]
Mr. Quinelle!
Morning, Betty!
Mr. Stoddard would like you to step into the board room.
He wants to see me?
You can go right in.
[last lines]
Tell me things are gonna work out, Sonny.
Everything's gonna work out.
Yeah, yeah. Boy, it's been a strange winter, hasn't it?
Not really.
No.
I never thought I'd be contemplating marriage to a man who owned an automatic assault rifle.
It's not automatic, hon. It's semiautomatic. Automatic weapons are illegal. And why are you using the word "contemplating?"
I just mean, Donald, you seem so different.
Hey, Frizzer, I'm no different, I'm just armed.
